source.value: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-02: The Mosquito Witch

description.value: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt.

Enemies in the area must succeed at a Will save or take a -1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area.

Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast bane, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw.

Bane can counteract @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Bless]{Bless}.

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.Spell Effect: Bane]{Spell Effect: Bane}

The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

  • Cook Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
  • Lift Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
  • Make Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile-it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
  • Tidy Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.

Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.
This thrown weapon is larger than an arrow but shorter than a javelin. It typically has a short shaft of wood ending in a metal tip and is sometimes stabilized by feathers or fur.
These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 3 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d8}[poison]]]{1d8 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage} (1 round)

A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Coerce]{Coerce}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Demoralize]{Demoralize}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Make an Impression]{Make an Impression}, and @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Request]{Request}.

Mitflits can use Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Make an Impression]{Make an Impression} on and @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Request]{Request} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Indifferent]{Indifferent} to mitflits.
The mitflit sneak deals an extra [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 precision damage} to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} creatures.
As long as it isn't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.
